title: Salvadoran President Bukele proposes prisoner swap with Maduro for Venezuelan deportees
Officials issue warning after hiker is attacked upon return to his vehicle: 'We encourage people ... to be aware of their surroundings'
Ukraine and Russia trade blame for breaking 'Easter truce'
description: Kyiv reports many cases of Russian shelling, while Moscow speaks of Ukrainian drone attacks during a truce that has now expired.

title: Rosenberg: Is Putin's 'Easter truce' cause for scepticism or chance for peace?
description: Ukraine and Russia have accused each other of violating a 30-hour truce, but it comes as diplomatic efforts pick up, Russia Editor Steve Rosenberg writes.

title: IDF says ‘misunderstanding’ led to killings of Gaza emergency workers
description: The IDF inquiry could lead to criminal charges from a military prosecutor, but it left key questions about the Gaza killings unanswered.
author: Louisa Loveluck, Gerry Shih, Miriam Berger

title: Pope meets Vance, then releases Easter message decrying ‘logic of fear’
description: The visit at the Vatican brought together the ailing head of the Catholic Church and a high-profile convert who has criticized the pope’s social teachings.
author: Natalie Allison, Anthony Faiola, Stefano Pitrelli

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Trump draft executive order would make sweeping changes to the U.S. State Department
description: The changes, outlined in a 16-page draft order, would dramatically upend the department and overhaul longstanding hiring practices and department priorities.

title: China keeps key lending rates steady in bid to shore up yuan as Trump tariffs pressure currency
description: The decision comes amid encouraging first quarter growth figures, with GDP recording a 5.4% rise year-on-year.

title: Jharkhand Chief Minister Visits Sagrada Familia In Barcelona
description: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren visited the iconic Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, accompanied by a delegation.

title: Trump Slams "Weak, Ineffective" Judges As Deportation Row Intensifies
description: The clash over President Donald Trump's bid to exercise unprecedented powers in deporting migrants deepened Sunday as he again bashed the judiciary, while a top Democrat warned the country was "closer and closer" to a constitutional crisis.

title: Ukraine Says Russia Violated Easter Truce
description: President Zelensky said that the front lines had seen artillery fire and drone attacks and that his troops were responding. Russia accused Ukraine of breaking the cease-fire.
author: Kim Barker

title: Why Saudi Arabia Supports Trump’s Nuclear Talks With Its Rival, Iran
description: The agreements are shaping up to be very similar. But Gulf support for a nuclear deal shows how much the region has changed.
author: Vivian Nereim

title: Alito criticizes US Supreme Court's decision to 'hastily' block deportations - Reuters
description: Alito criticizes US Supreme Court's decision to 'hastily' block deportations  ReutersWhat to know about the Supreme Court’s midnight Alien Enemies Act order  CNNAs legal fight raged, ICE buses filled with Venezuelans heading toward airport turned around, video shows  NBC NewsAn Urgent Supreme Court Order Protecting Migrants Was Built for Speed  The New York TimesDOJ asks Supreme Court to reject ACLU request to pause deportations  The Hill

title: Hegseth Said to Have Shared Attack Details in Second Signal Chat - The New York Times
description: Hegseth Said to Have Shared Attack Details in Second Signal Chat  The New York TimesWho is Jennifer Rauchet, Hegseth’s wife ‘included in Signal chat about Yemen attack?’  The IndependentHegseth shared detailed military plans in second Signal chat that included his wife and brother  CNNHegseth had another Signal chat where he shared details of Yemen strike, New York Times reports  AP NewsReport Hegseth Shared Attack Plans in 2nd Signal Chat Sparks Critics' Fury  Newsweek

title: Israel cancels visas of 27 French MPs as Macron signals support for Palestinian state
description: Israel revoked the entry visas of 27 French lawmakers and officials, citing threats to national interests, just before their planned visit to Israel and Palestinian territories. The group, comprised of left-wing members, said it intended to promote peace and cooperation. This action, denounced as collective punishment, follows similar incidents involving British and European politicians, highlighting tensions over Palestinian statehood recognition.
author: TOI World Desk

title: US defense chief shared sensitive Yemen strike info with wife, lawyer: Report
description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is under scrutiny for allegedly sharing sensitive military information about Yemen operations in a private Signal group, his second such incident. The group included his wife, brother, and personal lawyer. This follows an earlier leak involving National Security Advisor Mike Waltz, prompting a Pentagon investigation.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Tunisian court hands prison sentences of up to 66 years in mass trial of regime opponents
description: Opposition says trial was staged to entrench president Kais Saied’s authoritarian ruleA Tunisian court has handed down prison sentences of 13 to 66 years to politicians, businessmen and lawyers in a mass trial that opponents say is fabricated and a symbol of president Kais Saied’s authoritarian rule.Businessman Kamel Ltaif received the longest sentence of 66 years on Saturday, while opposition politician Khayam Turki was given a 48-year jail term, a lawyer for the defendants said. Continue reading...
author: Reuters

title: ‘I love my country but nobody is safe’: the plight of Cameroon’s exiles, trapped in Nigeria
description: English-speaking minority refugees caught up in clashes between the military and separatists are stranded in neighbouring countryAmid the sound of children excitedly practising a drama for a forthcoming performance, a yam seller calls to passers by with discounts for their wares. Outside a closed graphic design shop overlooking them from a small hill, Solange Ndonga Tibesa tells the story of being uprooted from her homeland in north-west Cameroon.In June 2019 she and other travellers were abducted with her three-month-old baby by secessionists, who accused them of supporting the military. Their captors repeatedly hit them with butts of their guns, keeping them in a forest without food or water. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Ogoja
